intro: Sethia lanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf Sethia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It is often found growing in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand dry conditions. Sethia lanceolata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
